org.patrodyne.etl.transformio.io
Enum ByteOrderMark

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<ByteOrderMark>
      org.patrodyne.etl.transformio.io.ByteOrderMark
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<ByteOrderMark>
public enum ByteOrderMark
extends Enum<ByteOrderMark>

An enumeration of ByteOrderMark (BOM). The byte order mark (BOM) is a Unicode character used to signal the endianness (byte order) of a text file or stream. BOM use is optional, and, if used, should appear at the start of the text stream. Beyond its specific use as a byte-order indicator, the BOM character may also indicate which of the several Unicode representations the text is encoded in.

Author:
Rick O'Sullivan
